intro: Ballota obliqua, commonly known as Spanish borage, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Ballota obliqua is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
